An intense dark purple hue. A distinguished and expressive nose of blackberry liqueur, black plum, and dark cherries. The palate is suave and made in the style for Cab lovers who enjoy big, bold fruit with sweet rich oak and layers of complex lush fruit. The palate is beautiful and stylized with decadent creme de cassis, currants, black raspberry, mocha, dark chocolate and toasty sweet vanilla oak. Plump and smooth tannins with a long, pleasant finish it was aged 2 years in 35% new French oak. Only 600 cases were produced. Enjoy 2012-2019.

Winery: Aromas of wild berries mixed with notes of black currant and eucalyptus on the nose. The long finish has hints of tobacco on the back palate. Lush and velvety with round tannins, this young wine will mature beautifully with time.

Winemaker Info: Reed Renaudin, owner and winemaker of Napa’s X Winery, has made a career of being the consummate outsider in the ultimate insider’s business. In the 11-year ascent of X Winery, Renaudin has spared no effort in peddling his products all across the country. Since the winery was but a twinkle in his eye, Renaudin has espoused the kind of spirit and tenacity necessary to take on the entrenched names and brands that dominate the wine business.

Vineyard Information: This wine came from a beautiful vineyard typical of Napa Valley. The 9 acre vineyard, planted in 2000 and sitting at 2,000 feet, consists exclusively of Cabernet grapes. The vineyard’s steep slopes require meticulous hand cultivation. 600 cases of this wine were produced.

Name: Napa/Sonoma Cabernet Sauvignon
Notes: The wine spent just over 2 years in French Oak barrels, 30% of which are new. The wine is about two-thirds from vineyards in Napa Valley and the other third are from Sonoma Valley. While the wine is classified as a Cabernet, it includes all five Bordeaux blending varietals, which makes the wine more complex with more depth.

Winery: A purple hue. A Bordeaux nose of dark cherries, licorice, creme de cassis and black currant. Nice body and layers of complexity with plum, blackberries, boysenberry, and dark cherries with touches of dark chocolate, tobacco, and cracked white pepper. Pair with Beef Wellington, Baby lamb chops with mint jelly, Coq au Vin, chicken in a rich mushroom sauce and game meats. Enjoy 2012-2018.*

Tasting Notes: toasted almond and sweet black cherry. leather on nose. will go well with beef, wild game and braised meats.

Name: Grand Vin
Tasting Notes: The eye observes a deep red ruby color with intense violet highlights. The nose perceives jammy aromas of red mature fruits, nuts, leather and chocolate. On the pallet it is very intense thanks to it`s mature tannins. It is well-structured, harmonic with a very long and persistent finish.

Winery: 10/12/2012 -- just back from NM...steak night tonight! This is spectacularly rich...wonderful with beef...decent coffee notes, too. Yummmm! Four bottles left!
Name: Great argentinean malbec-cab...tasted at Schneider's Feb. 25, 2012. Bought a half case.
The Boxer
Tasting Notes: Loads of black fruit. very dense.

Name: Estate Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
Tasting Notes: Rich, dark red fruit, especially cherriers, with touches of cinnamon, dried violets and chocolate. Long mocha finish.

Name: Versada Vineyard Chardonnay
Tasting Notes: On the nose, orange, lemon custard, pear. On the palate, vivid tropical fruit, citrus oils, vanilla, oak. Long, clean finish. Pairs well with scallops, tilapia, dover sole, chicken dishes with cream sauce.
Notes: Sold out. Winemaker quickly responded to my email inquiry about the drinking window. i like that.

Name: Napa Valley Petite Sirah
Tasting Notes: 100 percent Petite Syrah. On the nose: blueberries, with raspberries and blackberries. Needs a bit of time to open in the glass. The first sip is black fruit -- cherries, currants. Nice finish. Unfiltered -- may need decanting.

Name: The Boxer
Tasting Notes: Intense blackberry, licorice, tar, cocoa bean aromas. Full bodied with moderate tannins. Long finish.

Name: M Blend
Tasting Notes: Big wine. Pepper, plummy, cocoa. Consider decanding or at least allow to breathe for an hour or so. Lots of red cherry up front. tannic...needs a piece of meat.

Winery: Not a lot of acidity...kind of flat. Disappointing.
Name: Winebow, Inc.
If Six Was Nine Cabermet Reserve
Tasting Notes: Wow. Magnificent fruit on the nose...red cherry, blackberry, raspberry.  Rich...begs a steak. The juice for this wine comes from the same area that feeds many California cult wines.

Winery: This interesting Cabernet was grown in various parts of the valley, but you can detect a cool-climate influence in the acidity and especially the tannins, which are firm and astringent. Yet the wine, which contains small amounts of Merlot and Cabernet Franc, is remarkably ripe in blackberries, cherries and currants. Shows lots of elegance and complexity. Drink it over the next six years. S.H.  (2/1/2012)  — 91
Name: From song written by Jimi Hendrix in 1967.

Winery: Birthday and Christmas 2011 gifts from our wonderful kids, Dana and Josh, the First Family of Florida.
Name: Yes
Allegrini Palazzo Della Torre
Tasting Notes: licorice, tobacco, mocha and spices in the glass. Notes of dark, dried cherries, dates and mocha on the tongue. pair well with risotto, full-flavored pastas, roast poultry, chorizo, hard cheeses.

Winery: 30 percent of the fruit is dried amarone style. The winery calls this its "baby amarone."
Name: #60 on Wine Spectator's Top 100 wines-2011
Quartage
Tasting Notes: This is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdit, Rich, spicy, plums. spent 18 months in French and american oak. Screams for a steak.

Name: Russian River Valley Pinot Noir
Tasting Notes: On the nose, black cherries, blueberries, raspberries and a touch of cinnamon. On the palate, cranberries, cherries, plums, spice w/ good finish. Can go with filet to salmon/tuna.

Name: Moreccio
Tasting Notes: Raspberries and currants on the nose. On the palate, blackberry, cherry, pipe tobacco, leather. Full body, smooth tannis, long finish.
Notes: Enjoyed wioth Joan and Donn Feb. 6, 2016 over lasagna, a wonderful salad and fresh homemade Italian bread to learn about their trip to Buenos Aires, Mendosa and Chile.

Name: Stella Napa Valley Red
Tasting Notes: A lovely meritage from Yountsville and Coombsville. deep purple hue. Bouquet of blackberries, dark cherries, mocha and plum. On the palate, currants, blueberries, blasckberries, plums, dark chocolate with touches of cinnamon, coffee and vanilla. Good strong tannins -- NEEDS DECANTING.

Name: Astrales
Tasting Notes: A wonderful Temperanillo with silky tannins and a wonderfully long finish. On the nose, licorice, espresso, pencil lead. On the palate, spice, bitter chocolate, black pepper and boysenberry, whatever the hell that tastes like.

Winery: DECANT about three hours before serving.

Name: Alexander Valley Cabernet Franc
Tasting Notes: This Alexander Valley property is prominent for full-bodied and yet lush mountain fruit. It boasts a dark red garnet hue. A perfumed nose of vibrant dark red fruit including plum, dark cherries, cassis and toasty vanilla with touches of cinnamon and blueberries. On the palate, mouth watering and silky with layers of fruit including dark raspberry, dark cherry, cassis, blueberry and toasty vanilla oak with violets and a cinnamon spice box. Nice length and elegant with a long finish. Enjoy now and for several more years. Pair this with steak au poivre, rack of Lamb, roast beef with Yorkshire pudding, or braised shortribs.
Notes: Very highly rated cab franc for the vintage.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon--Winemaker's Cuvee
Tasting Notes: First vintage of its kind...entire vintage was sold to WTSO.
Notes: An inky purple hue. The nose is deep and inviting with black cherries, dark berries, and plum. Loads of expressive dark red fruit with intensity and finesse including cherries, sweet blackberry pie, and boysenberry with notes of cassis, violets and toasty vanilla oak. A lush mouth feel with silky, plump tannins and a nice pleasant finish. The fruit, structure and oak all integrate proudly with a wine that is drinking nicely now and will continue to shine for many more years to come. Pair with Porterhouse steaks au Poivre, Beef wellington, Osso Buco and leg of lamb.

Name: Old M Block Cabernet
Tasting Notes: Aged in French oak barrels (50% new) for 24 months, the subtle tones of vanilla and toast from the oak are well integrated and a nice counterpoint to the rich fruit characteristics. This is a big bold wine with full-bodied tannins, yet it has a beam of jammy richness that shines through from the initial attack right through to the long lingering finish. This wine will reward the patient decanter. It really opens up with beautiful complexity after about 30-45 minutes in the decanter.

Name: Estate Malbec
Tasting Notes: The 2009 drew scores of 90 and 91 by Advocate and Spectator. Good early reviews.

Name: Vendimia Seleccionada  Ribera del Duero
Tasting Notes: DECANT! Expect sediment; not fined. Tannic, so might let rest through 2015. Big nose--smoke, lavender, black cherry. concentrated, lengthy finish.

Name: Moreccio Super Tuscan
Tasting Notes: Best after 2013.  Crushed raspberries and currants on the nose; full body, blackberry, cherry, leather; velvety tannins, long finish.

Name: Super Tuscan
Tasting Notes: Best after 2013. Raspberries and currants on the nose; full-bodied, long finish, velvety tannins. 40-30-30 blend.

Name: The Chat09
Tasting Notes: Elegant, Blackberry, Fig, Full-bodied

Winery: Wine Spectator : A gutsy, square-jawed style, with a slightly burly chestnut and alder wood frame to the roasted fig, mulled blackberry and steeped black currant fruit. Ends with a solid, rustic-hewed finish."

Name: Tilenus Envejecido en Roble
Tasting Notes: On the nose, toasty oak, asian spices, lilacs, black raspberry. Very elegant with layers of fruit, nice finish.  Drink 2013-2020.

Name: Napa Cabernet Franc
Tasting Notes: A very limited edition. On the nose, black cherries, plums, blueberries, a touch of vanilla. On the palate, black cherries, plums, dark chocolate. Will be great with steaks, roasts, stews, boeuf bourguinone

Name: Threesome Cabernet Sauvignon
Tasting Notes: DECANT!  This is a big wine as it has almost 70% Cabernet from Dr. Andolsen’s well regarded vineyard in the Dry Creek  known for very big, bold Cabernets. It also has small amounts of Cabernet Franc from the Pedroni Vineyard and Merlot from the Schneider Vineyard.  A dark ruby red hue. Distinguishing aromatics of blueberries, kirsch, dark plum and nutmeg. Very bold flavors that will benefit from aeration including dark cherry, red currants, and violets with floral and licorice notes. Pleasant tannins and a nice even finish, enjoy 2012-2018.

Name: Malbec
Tasting Notes: The 2010 Estaciones Malbec (100%) received the same elevage as the Cabernet. Notions of spice box, lavender, red licorice, and black cherry inform the nose of a spicy, flavorful Malbec with good balance and length. It is a very good value meant for drinking over the next 2-3 years.

Name: FourPlay Merlot Blend
Tasting Notes: DECANT!   2009 four play is an unique blend created by fondling 49% merlot, 34% syrah, 12% cabernet franc and 5% cabernet sauvignon until perfectly aroused. Flirtatious aromas of wild berry, exotic spice, cocoa and subtle anise get your mouth in the mood for a tongue lashing of red and black fruit flavors. Naughty oak textures are spanked with a firm handful of tannins to subdue a premature climax. Take your time and let this open up to invite a perfectly timed finish. 200 cases crafted. Vegan.
Notes: Provocative aromas of mainly black and some red fruit on the nose with blueberries, blackberries with touches of mint and vanilla. An enticing palate of bold fruit including ripe dark cherries, dark raspberries, mocha, and licorice. This wine could use some aerating or decanting and will be a mighty fine wine that will provide many years of enjoyment. Pair with small dinner parties and good friends and enjoy with Ribeye steaks, baby lamb chops with mint jelly, Osso Bucco, and game or grilled meats.

Name: JJ Gran Reserva Malbec Blend
Tasting Notes: The 2003 JJ Jacinto Jaure Gran Reserva is a blend of Malbec (40%), Cabernet Sauvignon (30%), and Syrah (30%). The fruit was sourced from a 53-year-old vineyard and aged for 18 months in new French oak before being bottled unfiltered. Purple in color, it has a fragrant bouquet of pain grille, Asian spices, pencil lead, black cherry, blueberry, and black currant. Ripe and sweet on the palate, it has plenty of silky tannin well concealed under a blanket of fruit. Nicely balanced and lengthy, it will evolve for 6-8 years and drink well through 2025.

Name: Chateauneuf du Pape
Tasting Notes: Aerate and decant.

Winery: Enjoyed two bottles with beef stroganoff; with joan and donn and ernie and zita -- dec. 7, 2013. Wow, what a great party and what a fine wine. Great evening!
Name: The 2007 vintage was one of the greatest in Chateauneuf-du-Pape in history; now a very expensive vintage. This wine is full bodied, dense and indeed cellar worthy. This is primarily Grenache with smaller parts of the other regional grape varietals including Cinsault, Syrah and Mourvedre.

Winery: A purple- red garnet hue. Dense and packed aromas of black cherries, black raspberries, and dark red fruit with touches of cassis and pepper. On the palate, full bodied, juicy and nicely textured with good depth. Bountiful flavors of black cherries, blackberries, licorice, black and red currants, intermixed with pepper, herbs, lavender, incense and spice. Nice complexity in a full bodied but lush style with pleasant tannins. This wine should be aerated to enjoy now and is made to cellar over the next 7-10 years.
Enjoy with Chateaubriand, baby lamb chops with mint jelly, rich lamb or beef stews, veal cheeks and traditional regional cheeses like Munster.
Name: Yes
Cabernet Sauvignon
Tasting Notes: Medium-bodied cabernet...some structure...soft tannins.
Notes: We tasted this wine on Oct. 7, 2012 at the winery in Ignacio...it will be served at Meg and Nick's wedding next year.

Name: Lot 336 Rutherford Cabernet Sauvignon
Tasting Notes: Taste: Lot 336 reveals blackberry, classic red dust, loam, olive tapenade, toasty oak, and violets. Graceful texture exhibits pure minerality, fine grained tannins and beautiful resolve. Fabulous.

Winery: Cameron Confidential: The classic "Rutherford dust" fine-grained, supple tannins identified with this region enable this wine to be enjoyable young but make no doubt those that cellar this wine will be greatly rewarded. This wine is one of a series of wines we will be producing with one of Napa Valley’s premier grape growing families. It’s a match made in Heaven. They own and farm thousands of Napa Valley’s best dirt, but have only a small brand of their own.

Name: x-Envejecido en Roble Bierzo
Tasting Notes: Toasty oak, Asian spices, lilacs and black raspberry on the nose.  On the tongue, a bit balsamic, sweet tannins, glycerin and a long finish.

Name: Napa Valley Chardonnay
Tasting Notes: An alluring nose of white peach, and pear with touches of asian spice and toasty oak. Nicely layered with generous fruit including pear, lemon zest and melon, with touches of peach, white flowers with well integrated oak. This cheerful Napa Valley Chard has a nice mouth feel, and a pleasant finish. Enjoy with Scallops in a garlic butter sauce, mussels in a white sauce, pistachio encrusted tilapia, salt encrusted Bronzino, and chicken in a cream sauce.

Name: Garnacha
Tasting Notes: On the noser, sweet cherries, ripe plums...white pepper and spices on the finish.
Notes: Looking at this as a house wine. Bought to taste and evaluate. Suggested by Bill @ Total.

Name: Dao
Notes: Candidate for our house red...from Bill @ Total.

Name: Tempranillo
Notes: Recommended by Bill @ Total for a house wine.

Name: Red Table Wine
Notes: Recommended as an everyday wine by Bill @ Total.

Name: Stagecoach Vineyard Syrah
Tasting Notes: Only 261 cases produced. Aromas of creme de cassis, dark cherries, licorice and white pepper. (Bacon fat?) On the palate, dark cherries, blackberries, mocha, chocolate and sweet oak with touches of allspice and cinnamon. Long clean finish. Begs for meat -- beef, veal, lamb chops, beef stew. Reminiscent of the Rhone Valley. 20 months in barrel.
Notes: Winery is named after his daughter...Tallulah Bankhead is a distant cousin.

Name: Napa Valley Sangiovese
Tasting Notes: Red cherries, licorice with floral red plum and spice notes on the nose. On the tongue, dark red fruit, including cherry, plum and anise with touches of cocoa, vanilla and nutmeg. Good round tannins. Will pair nicely with veal parmesan, rosemary chicken, spaghetti bolognese and barbecued meats. very food friendly.

Name: Antiguas Reservas
Tasting Notes: True Maipo aromas of tobacco, eucalyptus, earth and herbal berry lead to a full and rugged palate with plenty of tannic grip and loads of black fruit, cassis and chocolate flavors. Long and more chocolaty on the finish, with a touch of medicinality. -- 89 Points, Wine Enthusiast--more

Winery:
Deep ruby. Oak-spiced aromas of red- and blackcurrant and dried flowers, with slow-building smokiness. Offers nicely focused dark berry flavors and notes of candied rose and sweet chewing tobacco. WA: The Bella Vista is always based on four hectares planted in 1910 and is normally the second vineyard harvested each year. The 2010 Finca Bella Vista is a pure Malbec from Lujan de Cuyo located at 980 meters altitude. Fermented in cement and aged for 16 months in new French barriques from the Mercurey cooperage, it has a sublime bouquet of blackberry, briary, woodland aromas and sous-bois that is all succinctly defined. The palate is medium-bodied with ripe, fine tannins surrounding a core of pure blackberry and wild strawberry fruit, interlaced by lemon rind and dark chocolate towards the controlled, refined finish. This is class from start to finish. Drink 2013-2020+.

Name: Christmas gift from Dana and Josh--2012...in North Port...same visit on which we learned of the baby.

Winery: Enjoyed with filets and polenta with a garllicky tomato sauce to celebrate the third anniversary of our retirement. Aug. 29, 2018.
Name: Yes
Morgon Red Beaujolais
Tasting Notes: Wines from the Morgon region age very gracefully...the French created a term for these wines as they age: Ils Morgon.

Name: Swinto (Crow) Malbec
Tasting Notes: Made from 100+ -year old vines at more than 3,000 feet. Complex, darkly fruity and minerally on the nose with a palate of red stone fruits accented with spicy, toasty notes. Unfiltered -- DECANT.
Notes: We bought our first bottle at the winery during our Argentina trip of 2011.

Winery: 3/25/15--still fresh and lovely. great match with roast pork leftovers last night. yummy!
Name: Yes
Cairanne Cotes du Rhone
Tasting Notes: Almost black in color with strong aromatics of black fruits -- blackberries, blueberries and currants as well as gamy notes and violets. DECANT for at least one hour. From the wonderful 2010 Rhone vintage.
Notes: Tasted with Donn Edwards at Schneider's with Jon.  Enoyed 2 bottles with Marilyn & Rich, Ken and Liz--Dec. 14, 2013.

Name: Smeriglio Syrah
Tasting Notes: Don't drink before 2015. On the nose, violet, blackberry, olive and lavender. On the palate, rich and powerful with currant and spices and hints of coffee.

Name: Cotes du Rhone Rouge
Tasting Notes: Winemaker: a dark, plum-like hue. The nose is classic Syrah, with berry fruit, violet, licorice and spices. It has a full, rounded palate with delicate tannins. Saint-Esprit is a unique wine in the Cotes-du-Rhone appellation and can be paired with Provençale-style cuisine, game, stuffings and mixed grills.

Winery: Wine Advocate: a real winner with lots of Provencal herb notes interwoven with loamy, earthy, peppery, kirsch and black currant characteristics...medium bodied.

IWC: Deep ruby. Shows good complexity on the nose, offering red fruit and floral qualities with pungent olive and herb nuances. Spice-accented raspberry and cherry flavors show good depth and become more energetic with air. Closes on a gently sweet note, with good length and a late kick of cracked pepper."

Name: La Louvee Cornas Syrah
Tasting Notes: Aromas of licorice, mocha and blackberry. Smooth tannins, long finish, a lush, rich, full-bodied wine with intense plum tastes. Meant for beef, game, mushrooms. Best after 2013.

Name: Conn Valley Vineyard Latitude 38 Bordeaux Blend
Tasting Notes: Big nose of cassis, black cherries, herbs and oak. An elegant, rich wine with black cherries, cedar and herbs and supple, smooth tannins.
Notes: From one of my favorite Napa vintners. Latitude 38 30 mins. and longitude 122 24 is the center of the vineyard that sourced the grapes.

Name: Cuvee Isabelle Chateauneuf du Pape
Tasting Notes: Parker: Full-bodied showing lots of garrigue, black cherry and cedar wood. Lots of glycerin and good overall balance.  91

Winery: Tanzer: Dark purple with heavy notes of blueberries and garrigue. Smoky notes as it breathes. Nice finish. 90-92.

Name: McLaren Vale Shiraz
Tasting Notes: Black fruits, mocha, dark chocolate on the nose; a full-bodied wine with blackberry, cherry, spices and chocolate on the palate.

Name: Royce Alexander Valley Bordeaux Red Blend
Tasting Notes: From a late harvest, 10% cab and 90% merlot. Named by owner Nick Goldschmidt after his eldest son, who also helped him make it. On the nose, cherry liquer and plum. In the mouth, blackberry, red berries, mocha, toasty vanilla and cinnamon spice.   Good mouthfeel...needs a year or two in bottle to integrate.
Notes: Unfined. DECANT for a couple of hours. Put a bit of a chill on this wine.

Name: Vacqueyras Rhone Blend
Tasting Notes: Dense purple with strong aromas of cassis, blackberries and acacia flowers. Full-bodied, silky tannins, low acidity. Long finish.

Name: tempus Fugit
Tasting Notes: Big wine...great with steaks, ribs or barbecue

Name: Les Larmes du Pere St. Joseph
Tasting Notes: Dark black fruits, spices, licorice, dried earth. Tastes of blackberry and raspberry with leather notes. Medium-full body, smooth tannins. Good acidity. DECANT through the first five years.
Notes: Joan and Donn introduced this wine to us with grilled tuna at their house in April 2013. I was so impressed I bought a half case from Julie @ WTSO.Very smooth and rich. From the magnificent 2010 Rhone vintage -- 96 by Spectator; 94 by Parker.

Name: Chateauneuf-du-Pape
Tasting Notes: WS: Silky and refined., blackberry and black cherry fruit, fine tannins, hints of black pepper and espresso.  Rich

Name: Brunello di Montalcino
Tasting Notes: Purchased at the 2013 PEO wine auction. Big, bold wine. Lots of minerality. Dark cherries, licorice, mint, sweet spices. Soft finish. Chocolaste, mint notes on the nose.
Notes: Best 2014-222. three years in oak. Allow to breathe for a couple of hours.

Name: Aglianoco del Vulture
Tasting Notes: Red roses, red fruit, herbs, cinnamon, rosemary, tobacco on the nose. Silky, elegant. Firm tannins. Long finish. Fruit, acidity and structure are in balance.

Name: Poggio Quercioloa Super Tuscan
Tasting Notes: Dark cherries, tobacco, leather, graphite, silky tannins, long, silky finish. Excellent length on the finish. Intense balsamic and mint notes on the finish. DECANT. Best after 2015.

Name: Chateauneuf du Pape
Tasting Notes: Lots of black fruit, cherries and raspberries, root beer, pepper, creme de cassis; on the palate, pepper, lavender, provence spices, cocoa.
Notes: Enjoyed three bottles with beef stroganoff with joan and donn and ernie and zita -- dec. 7, 2013.  One bottle for "France Night."

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon
Tasting Notes: Found this beauty at Schneider's with Rick in May 2013.  Aged in French Oak for 30 months. Ripe, concentrated and complex, lovely smooth finish. Aromas and flavors of bright cherry, currant and cocoa are accented by traces of leather, eucalyptus and white pepper notes. This is an excellently balanced wine. This wine ends with finely integrated tannins and a long, lingering finish.

Name: Montefalco Sagrantino
Tasting Notes: Firm yet beautifully balanced tannins frame the dark fruit. Hints of licorice, tar and medicinal herbs develop in the glass, adding further complexity. The Colle Grimaldeso is opulent but not over the top. Anticipated maturity: 2014-2022.

Name: Cabernet Sauvignon Reserva
Tasting Notes: A well-defined bouquet of blackberry, raspberry, vanilla essence and dried orange peel that is vibrant and engaging. The palate is well-balanced with crisp tannins. It is a more reserved take on Cabernet, more Old World in style, refined and elegant with impressive precision on the finish

Name: Setena Terra Alta Red Blend
Notes: Setena is the Catalan word for "seventh" -- the amount of the harvest farmers paid landowners for the right to work the land.

Name: Conn Valley /cabernet Sauvignon
Tasting Notes: Bright, but deep ruby color with a hint of purple. On the nose, blackberries, violets and currants. On the palate, concentrated flavors of sweet blackberries, ripe cherries, spice and a touch of earthiness. Long finish.

Name: 12 Uve "One grape, one note"
Tasting Notes: Aromas of caramel and berries with hints of dried fruits. Full bodied with ripe tannins and a very fruity finish.

Name: Les Tavannes Pommard
Tasting Notes: A brilliant ruby hue. Bright and well-defined aromas of intense fruit, including cherries, strawberries, pomegranate, red licorice and red flowers. The palate is very structured with black raspberries, cherry tart, plum and a touch of cinnamon spice. A long, suave finish. Pair with coq au vin, veal cordon bleu, beef burgundy.
Notes: 2010 was a very tiny and very collectible vintage. Made for aging.

Name: Estate Cabernet Sauvignon
Tasting Notes: A dark ruby, almost purple color.  On the nose, blackberries, violets and black currants. On the palate, concentrated flavors of blackberries, ripe cherries, spice and a touch of earth with a long and lingering finish.
Notes: By winemaker Gus Anderson. We love his wines.

Name: Unknown Smith Anderson Enterprises Inc. bottle
Reserve Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
Tasting Notes: A bright nose of blackberry, cocoa and Kirsch with touches of sage and vanilla. Medium bodied with a smooth, silky mouthfeel, round tannins. on the palate, dark raspberries with cherry, plum and mocha. Lots of red fruit and a hint of chocolate on the finish.

Name: Estate Cabernet Sauvignon
Tasting Notes: Distinctly big and rich. Aromas of plum, kirsch, cherries and toasty vanilla oak. Generous dark red fruit, especially cherries and black raspberries. Silky mouthfeel with well-integrated tannins and a long finish.

Name: Reserve du Couvent
Tasting Notes: A french Bordeaux blend with Grenache, Syrah and Mourvedre? Decant and let it breathe for at least an hour.

Winery: Translucent dark red with pink rim, but still a hint of youthful purple. Baked herb nose and an intriguing element of currant. Firm, mineral mouthful, balanced tannins. Leather and tobacco leaf linger, clean and chewy. At least five years in it yet.

Mild aromas of dried cherries, berries, cocoa and forest floor with a very tart light-to-medium body and a lit cigar and charred nut accented finish with heavy tannins. Pair with rabbit stew or goulash.
Name: A gift from Gabbie when she returned from visiting her parents in Lebanon in July, 2013.
Blanc de Blancs
Tasting Notes: This is a really interesting wine, totally unlike anything I've had before. It's a blend of 50 pct Sauvignon blanc and 25 pct each of semillon and chardonnay. The Sauvignon blanc adds acidity which balances the oily, honeyed semillon and then you get some new world Chardonnay tropical fruit but not enough to irritate. Weird and delicious, will be a summer staple and probably very good with Szechuan or traditional Thai food, shrimp, grilled chicken.
Notes: A gift from Gabbie. we enjoyed this wine with Gabbie and Andrew over Thanksgiving dinner 2013.

Name: Chateauneuf du Pape
Tasting Notes: AERATE!! Tiare Imperiale is only released in the top vintages and the 2010 is the first release since the 2007. This is a beautifully made and gorgeous Chateauneuf with extreme value for such a collectible vintage. A compelling taste profile and an age-worthy Chateauneuf du pape, it is a blend of all the regional grape varietals including Grenache, Syrah, Cinsault and Mourvedre. Opaque with shades of purple, black and red. Classical and distinguished aromas of lush black raspberries and black cherry shining through with touches of kirsch and spring flowers. A generous and silky palate of sweet black cherry jam, kirsch, licorice, toasty vanilla oak and red currants, with hints of dark chocolate, blueberry, boysenberry and a spice box. Made in a smooth velvety style with round tannins. This wine should still be aerated for early enjoyment and is made to cellar for many years.
Notes: Winery notes: This Chateauneuf-du-Pape is characteristic of its appellation with its beautiful purple colour. On the nose, it develops a complex bouquet of red fruit aromas mingling with truffles and spices. The mouth, robust and generous, displays a structure which will enable it to gain in quality over time. It is a perfect match for game, venison, meat cooked in sauces and all strong cheeses.

Name: Russian River Valley Pinot Noir
Tasting Notes: Bountiful aromas of fresh dark red fruit, including black cherries, plums, cinnamon and blueberry. On the tongue, dark cherry predominate with pomegranate, blueberry, rhubarb, floral notes and allspice.

Name: Spring Mountain District Napa Valley Cabernet Reserve
Tasting Notes: Aromas of toasty oak and cherry fruit. Blackberrries, cherries, chocolate, and cinnamon spice on the palate.

Name: Tiempo Crianza
Tasting Notes: OPEN 20-30 MINUTES BEFORE SERV ING.

Winery: Raspberry preserves and cassis with faint hints of incense on the nose. Smooth and silky on the palate with lush dark cherries and plum notes leading to a long and smooth finish.

Name: Tassinaia
Tasting Notes: RP: Open two hours before serving. Beautifully delineated layers of dark fruit, mocha, espresso, licorice, leather and spices. This is an unusually ripe, expansive Tassinaia with enough richness and sheer pedigree to challenge some of the estate’s more expensive bottlings. Sweet grilled herbs and spices add a final flourish on the powerful close, with notes of brightness from the Sangiovese that act as a foil to some of the darker nuances in the wine. In 2006 Tassinaia is nothing short of magnificent. These are far from the easygoing, open reds made throughout much of Tuscany’s Maremma.

Winery: Tanzer:  Full, dark red. Complex, scented nose offers blackcurrant, blueberry, cedar, mint and aromatic herbs. Juicy, silky and complex, with highly nuanced flavors of pure blackberry, aromatic herbs and minerals.

Name: Les Origines Chateauneuf du Pape
Tasting Notes: The 2009 Chateauneuf du Pape Les Origines (1,500 cases produced) is a blend of 50% Grenache, a whopping 30% Mourvedre and 20% Syrah with the latter two components spending time in new oak barrels. All of the fruit comes from vines that are nearly 70 years of age. A great wine with an opaque ruby/purple color, sensational fruit intensity and notes of graphite, lavender, licorice, lead pencil shavings and subtle smoke, it is full-bodied, rich and powerful with low acidity and sweet, velvety tannins. It should drink well for 15+ years. Lots of raspberry, blackberry notes.

Name: x-Chateauneuf du Pape Blanc
Tasting Notes: A perfectly harmonious blend of 25% Clairette, 25% Roussanne, 25% Grenache Blanc, and 25% Bourboulenc. A full-bodied white with rich, ripe pear fruit that develops into floral and herby peachiness. The wine has a long leesy character and fresh acidity. Attractive when young but worth leaving for a couple of years, which will allow the wine to develop some wonderful nutty and mineral notes. 8 year ageing potential, possibly even a decade. A real treat on its own or with goat's milk or sheep's milk cheeses, delicate pork or full flavoured fish dishes with cream and herbs such as dill. Also goes well with shellfish and pretty much any seafood and stands up well to rich cream sauces.
Notes: Will enjoy this with swordfish on Meg's visit to check out her dad on Feb. 24, 2016. A perfect wine for my perfect women!

Name: Old Vine Zinfandel
Tasting Notes: Only 375 cases made.  "This is perhaps the smoothest, silkiest and most seductive tasting Zinfandel I’ve ever made.  The color is an amazing and dark garnet followed by richness and ripeness found in Zins that come only ever so often. The aromatics are well stacked in the glass beginning with sweet red fruit and flowed by barrel vanillin and sweet cocoa. Lastly the typical Zin white pepper and spice finds its place in the furthermost layers of the nose. Moving from the aromatics to the first taste, getting to enjoy this wine is a much anticipated event. The flavors are a pleasant twist of blackberry, vanilla, cassis and sweet density from old vine age supported by the oak. Tannin and acid are interlaced as well offering plenty for this rich Zinfandel to support itself upon. A polished and pleasing wine that rides the fine line of ripeness with textured mouthfeel and finish that satisfies for over 45 seconds after the first taste. I would anticipate this wine drinking well from inception to 2019 and well beyond." - Kirk Venge, Winemaker
Notes: Highly recommended by Terry at Schneider's.  For a special evening with Louise.

Name: Quimera Red Blend
Tasting Notes: WA: Pain grille, pencil lead, Asian spices, incense, violets, and assorted black fruits inform the nose of a complex, intense, layered, spicy, succulent wine with impeccable balance and length. Although it can be approached now, it will benefit from another 2-3 years of cellaring.
Notes: The 2009 Quimera is a blend of Malbec, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, and Petit Verdot with yields averaging a minuscule 1.3 tons per acre. The wine was aged in 40% new French oak.

Name: Dai Colli Della Toscana Centrale
Tasting Notes: WS: Very pure and intense, featuring raspberry, black currant, cherry and spice aromas and flavors. There's ample oak for support, as well as firm tannins and bright acidity, but this is all about the fruit, silky texture and persistent aftertaste. Best from 2014 through 2025.

Winery: JS:  Love the aromas of dried fruits and Indian spices. Full body, with silky tannin and a long and wonderful finish. Shows depth and a lot of class. Already beautiful and balanced.
Name: Ruby Red Records
Nemorino Toscano Rosso
Tasting Notes: James Suckling: Love the aromas of dried fruits and Indian spices. Full body, with silky tannin and a long and wonderful finish. Shows depth and a lot of class. Already beautiful and balanced.

Name: Crianza
Tasting Notes: WA: Balsam wood, tobacco, cinnamon, clove, violets, and black fruit aromas lead to a ripe, sweetly-fruited, nicely proportioned Crianza that is likely to blossom for another 1-2 years and drink well through 2020. Bodega Dinastia Vivanco is a must visit for wine tourists. The winery is designed to be accessible to visitors but the principal attraction is the finest wine museum I have ever seen. Called Museo de la Cultura del Vino, it is beautifully designed and filled to the brim with artifacts from all aspects of wine from farming to drinking. As for the wines, Dinastia Vivanco has been flying under the radar screen but with a new importer on board, it is highly likely that their wine will receive greater exposure.

Winery: WS: Velvety and voluptuous, this generous red delivers plum, blackberry, chocolate and toast flavors, with broad, soft tannins and just enough acidity to stay lively. The finish is graceful.
Name: No. 58 on Wine Spectator's 2011 Top 100 list. Rated a Smart Buy.
Coteaux Sauvages Estate Red
Tasting Notes: A beautifully nuanced and classic bouquet of ripe and lush Rhone varietals including concentrated black cherries, cassis, dark cherry and plum. Boasting both focused intensity and pure elegance with blackberries, currants, plum, mocha and dark cherries with touches of licorice, floral notes, cracked white pepper and vanilla. Layers upon layers of complexity, and well balanced with supple tannins and a persistent finish. The wine sells for $60 in their tasting room. Enjoy 2013-2018,

Name: Reserve Merlot
Tasting Notes: Aromas of dark cherries, and notes of sage and spice. The body has dark fruit and smooth tannins, and finish.This Merlot is an outstanding accompaniment to braised pork, Cassoulet, and sautéed beef tips

Name: Cotes du Rhone
Tasting Notes: The 2011 was the third straight outstanding vintage in the southern Rhone.

Name: Reserve Russian River Valley Pinot Noir
Tasting Notes: Rich and silky with pleasing tannins. A ruby red hue with flavorful aromas of dark red fruit including black raspberry, black cherries and red flowers. Generous and clean dark red fruit on the palate, including pomegranate, red plum, black cherry, cassis and sassafras, with cinnamon on the finish.
Notes: Pair with pork chops, grilled salmon, Cornish game hens, chicken dishes and brie cheese.

Winery: 1/21/14--would be much better with pork than chicken -- the Queen.
Name: No
Essential Red
Notes: We had this as our "house" wine for Meg's wedding.  We also served this at the post-christening party for Mikey.

Name: Dairyman Vineyard Pinot Noir
Tasting Notes: We had this with grilled salmon and wild mushroom risotto on the deck for Mother's Day 2015.

Winery: WS: Rich and dense, this offers a potent mix of berry pie flavors that are lively, complex and well-oaked.

The aromas are abundant with bright cherry, cranberry and brown spice, reminiscent of warm cinnamon toast topped with plum jam. On the palate, the bright cherry opens the show, then evolves into a lush, sweetly spiced plum pudding, coating the mouth with a velvety richness. The wine then develops an intense mineral note, adding yet another dimension, lending way to silky tannins and a lengthy finish.
Name: A gift from Julie. Wow!  Winemaker Joseph Wagner chose the name Belle Glos to honor his grandmother, Lorna Belle Glos Wagner, a co-founder of Caymus Vineyards.

Winery: Situated in the southern alluvial plains of the Russian River Valley, Dairyman Vineyard’s proximity to the Pacific Ocean results in a cool morning fog and afternoon coastal breezes that elongate the growing season. This gives us small, concentrated and flavorful berries, producing bright cherry characteristics, brown spices, and a keen minerality overlaid with a rich, velvety mouth feel. Once an old dairy farm, the pastureland was planted to Dijon clone Pinot Noir in 2000, preserving the deep agricultural history of the property.
Name: Yes
Carneros Reserve Pinot Noir
Tasting Notes: A striking, pretty wine with an effusive nose of fresh fruit including dark cherry, black raspberry and blueberry with molasses and cinnamon. Nicely nuanced and complex with generous dark red fruit, and nutmeg spice with a bright and silky finish with floral and spicy notes. Pair with Cajun fish, Filet Mignon, and Japanese style sesame scallops. Less than 1,000 cases were produced.

Name: This is a particularly pretty and well-made wine from the Robert Storey collection. 2009 was a nice vintage for Pinot Noir in Carneros and Mark has made a complex wine with a very nice consumer taste profile that will provide enjoyment for several more years.
Chateauneuf du Pape
Tasting Notes: A generous and silky palate of sweet black cherry jam, kirsch, licorice, toasty vanilla oak and red currants, with hints of dark chocolate, blueberry, boysenberry and a spice box. Made in a smooth velvety style with round tannins.
Notes: only offered in outstanding years. The first Tiare Imperiale CDP since 2007.

Winery: Three bottles are a gift from Julie Blount at WTSO.
Name: Yes
Cabernet Sauvignon
Tasting Notes: oct. 17, 2014 -- had with andrew and gabbie.

Name: Chateauneuf du Pape
Tasting Notes: A dark ruby red hue with purple highlights. Nicely nuanced aromas of fresh black cherries, with touches of blueberries, kirsch and red flowers. A particularly silky palate of cherry liqueur, kirsch, vanilla oak and red currants, with chocolate, blueberry, and boysenberry cream. Enjoy with baby lamb chops with mint jelly, roasted and barbequed meats, sirloin steaks, elk and other game meats.

Name: Valdejalon
Tasting Notes: The 2005 Mancuso was aged for 14 months in new French oak. It offers up a superb bouquet of toasty new oak, pencil lead, scorched earth, espresso, black cherry, and blackberry liqueur. Opulent, rich, and complex on the palate, this full-bodied wine has tons of flavor, nicely concealed ripe tannin, and a long, fruit-filled finish. Cellar it for 6-8 years and drink it from 2016 to 2030. The Mancuso project began in 2000 with the purchase of five parcels of old vine Garnacha in the obscure region of Valdejalon (between Calatayud, Carinena, and Rioja).

Name: Morellino di Scansone - Riserva
Tasting Notes: The 2006 Morellino di Scansano Tempo Riserva is a darker wine laced with smoke, earthiness grilled herbs, black cherries and an array of darker aromas and flavors. Still quite brooding, this masculine, intense Morellino will require a measure of patience, something I don’t think I have ever written about a Morellino in the past. Make no mistake about it, this is a serious wine. The Riserva is 90% Sangiovese, 5% Alicante, 5% Cabernet Sauvignon.
Notes: A gift from Joan and Donn

Name: Carneros Red Wine
Tasting Notes: An absolutely gorgeous big and zesty red wine made from top Cabernet, Merlot and Petite Verdot vineyards. An inky purple hue. Perfumed aromatics of crème de cassis, toasty oak, mocha, berries and blackberry cream. Mouth watering, big and intense yet smooth with generous dark red fruit including black cherries, and black raspberries, with smoky toasty vanilla oak, caramel and violets. There are multiple layers of concentration, a silky mouth feel and a very pleasant finish. Will pair nicely with a wide range of meat dishes including Prime Rib, Sirloin steak, brisket sandwiches and even baby back ribs. Best enjoyed now through 2022.

Name: Langhe Nebbiolo
Tasting Notes: A big table wine...perfect with meat sauces, hard cheeses and pastas.

Name: Paso de Piedra Malbec
Tasting Notes: A gift from  Ernie & Z at our Christmas dinner 12/7/13 with Joan and Donn. Consumed w/grilled porkchops on 7/14/16. Just delicious...was nowhere near its peak.

Name: Deep purple in color, with a spicy aroma, plum, raisins, and dark cherry-like flavors. Tannins are soft, velvety, and sweet. Very elegant, full-bodied, and a long finish which shows off its splendor and richness.

Winery: RP: The 2010 Paso de Piedra Malbec (100%) spent 12 months in a 50-50 mix of new and used French oak. It offers up an exceptionally fragrant perfume of cedar, Asian spices, a hint of balsamic, black cherry, and blueberry. This is followed by a concentrated, ripe, savory wine that over-delivers in a big way. It is an outstanding value." 90 Points
Name: No
Duos
Tasting Notes: Gift from Joan and Donn 12-7-13.  Have never tasted from this winery before. Looks good.

Name: Syrah
Tasting Notes: April 25, 2016--Wow. Enjoyed with griloled pork chops. It was lovely. Big, well-structured, soft tannins and a lovely long finish. Only one bottle left -- sob!

Winery: The Odyssey Vineyard is located right next to the famed Stagecoach Vineyard and has a similar stylized taste of other nice Syrahs made in this viticultural are like Krupp Brothers and Tallulah. Arger-Martucci is one of those top boutique Napa houses that only release their vintages when the wine is drinking optimally so this wine has only been released in the past year. 2007 is one of the top vintages in the last decade and it is getting quite rare to find these wines now as they got snapped up shortly after release. These Mountain vines from the Odyssey and Isabella Vineyards are low yielding and sit at an elevation of 1,250 and 1,350 feet. This wine spent 11 months in primarily new American oak. Only about 750 cases were produced. Penetrating aromas of crème de cassis, dark cherries, licorice and white pepper. The fruit is lush and full bodied with chocolate covered cherries, blackberries, mocha, and well integrated oak with touches of nutmeg and cinnamon. A smooth mouth feel, it has a long, pleasant finish. While drinking beautifully now, it certainly has many more years to go. Steaks or veal chops!
Name: Villa Helena Winery
Barolo del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba
Tasting Notes: #59 Top Cellar Selections 2011--Wine Enthusiast. Best after 2015.
Notes: WS: A vivacious Barolo, this is packed with sweet cherry, blackberry and raspberry fruit, augmented by leather and tobacco notes. Dense with tannins, leaving a sensation of raw silk around the gums, while the fruit and a mineral element play long on the finish. Best from 2014 through 2032. 900 cases made.

Winery: WE: An up-and-coming star of Barolo Serralunga, Rivetto delivers a supersized wine with immense concentration and rock-solid structure. In fact, this wine needs another 10-15 years of aging to complete its long evolution. Already present, however, are tonic tones of red cherry, coffee, mocha, spice and cured meat.
Name: No
Chateauneuf du Pape Cuvee Jumille
Tasting Notes: WS: Very ripe and enticing, with lots of juicy plum, blueberry and blackberry fruit held together with lightly grippy notes of bitter­sweet ganache and roasted apple wood. Long and lush through the finish, but stays well defined.

Winery: ST:  Bright violet. A fragrant, high-pitched bouquet displays scents of fresh red and dark berries, spice cake, potpourri and white pepper. Rich but lively, showing sweet blackberry and cherry flavors and a subtle note of candied lavender. Firmer on the finish, which strongly repeats the floral note

Name: Blockheadia Top of the Block RingnosII Pinot Noir
Location: Box in front of Pinot rack
Tasting Notes: JN: 2012 is a wonderful vintage made in a consumer-friendly style with accessible and generous lush fruit. This micro production Pinot has a ruby red hue. Fresh aromas of pleasant red fruit including wild strawberries and cherries with touches of blueberry and raspberry cream. This is an engaging Pinot Noir with pleasing flavors including raspberry, dark cherry, pomegranate, cranberry and cola, with white tea and cinnamon. Pair with Pork chops and apple sauce, grilled salmon, Long Island Duckling in a bing cherry sauce, and chicken dishes. Enjoy now and over the next several years.

Name: Montecucco
Tasting Notes: This is an excellent Montecucco with berries, walnuts and shaved chocolate. Full body, round tannins and a juicy finish. Drink now. One of the best Montecuccos in bottle. Made from sangiovese and colorino.

Name: Chianti Classico
Tasting Notes: This young wine shows underbrush aromas, with hints of forest floor and mushroom. The palate offers brooding but ripe tannins, with a juicy berry and plum core layered with sweet vanilla and café au lait accents.

Name: 2011 Reserva Vinho Regional Alentejano
Tasting Notes: Had our first bottle with Joan and Donn Feb. 8, 2014 with a magnificent Portuguese seafood stew cooked by Joan. Wow! Planning for our trip to Portugal in May. A wonderful nose and lovely on the palate with dark red fruit, white pepper, spices, licorice. however, the finish was disappointingly short...climbed up to the midpalate and quickly faded.
Notes: From the great 2011 vintage in the Douro

Name: Chateauneuf du Pape
Tasting Notes: RP: exhibits sexy kirsch liqueur notes intermixed with notions of roasted Provencal herbs, pepper, smoked meats and forest floor. It is a full-bodied, fat, fleshy Chateauneuf with a serious alcoholic punch.

Winery: IWR:  Brings lovely notes of raspberry, boysenberry, black cherry, damp forest floor, pine, fennel, pepper and wonderful underlying minerality. This sits on a medium frame and is supported by silky, fine-grained tannins. The pepper-tinged finish is soft, sleek and seductive.

WS: Ripe, polished and accessible now, with a delicious core of plum, blackberry and boysenberry stitched with sweet spice, red licorice and toasted vanilla bean notes. The long finish lets the sweet fruit drip without being jammy, thanks to a graphite edge.

Name: Reserve Chardonnay
Tasting Notes: A light yellow hue. The aromas reveal a nice mix of tropical and citrus fruit including pineapple, lemon custard and apples with cinnamon. On the palate, clean and pure fruit including Bartlett Pears, White Peaches, and white flowers with touches of orange, lemon cream, and apple. A solid aperitif and will also pair nicely with Crab cakes, Dover sole, Chilean sea bass, mussels in a white wine garlic sauce and chicken in a cream sauce. Enjoy now and over the next several years.

Name: CFR Estate Red Wine
Tasting Notes: This wine is far superior to the 2009 vintage which received quite strong ratings. This picturesque Vineyard sits on a 2,000 ft. rocky mountain slope. The winery is located about 22 miles from Napa Valley’s St. Helena appellation. Owner Allison Morey believes this is their best vintage ever and is rightfully proud of this monumental wine. It is mainly Cabernet Sauvignon with Cabernet Franc and Syrah. A deep purple hue. A distinguished nose of black cherries, kirsch and red flowers with thyme and violets. A palate that is both big and elegant with satin textured fruit including blackberry, black raspberry, mocha, dark chocolate, sweet vanilla oak and spice. Plump with smooth tannins and a long, persistent finish. The wine is quite cellar worthy and will drink nicely over the next 12 years and should age with elegance. Only 1,116 cases produced. Tasted in September and October 2013 with consistent tasting notes. It should pair nicely with Beef Wellington, steak friites, and leg of lamb with mint jelly, veal medallions in a rich sauce, grilled meats or dark chocolate.

Name: The Davey Estate Shiraz
Tasting Notes: RP: Deep purple-black colored with pronounced notes of warm blackberries and blueberries over cedar, violets and fertile loam plus subtle hints of Mediterranean herbs and game. The palate reveals a good concentration of ripe blackberry flavors with enlivening acid and a medium-firm level of fine grained tannins, finishing long. Approachable now, it should drink well to 2018+

Winery: JH: Strong purple-crimson; arguably speaks loudest of its region of origin, but there is no doubting its varietal character; blackberry, licorice, spice and plum are brought together in a seamless package, with a burnish of oak and fine, ripe tannins

Name: Aries Estate Malbec
Tasting Notes: The wine spent 16 months in one and two year French oak. Alluring aromas with sweet rich fruits quite pronounced including black cherry, plum, red flowers and mocha. Layers of smooth and approachable dark red fruit including black cherry, crème de cassis, and dark raspberry with touches of dark chocolate, oak and pepper. A long finish that is clean and pleasant. This wine is drinking very nicely now, and can be enjoyed for many more years.

Name: Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir
Tasting Notes: Probably the best Pinot Noir from Michel Schlumberger and winemaker Kerry Damskey. 2012 is a stunning vintage for Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir and this wine from their Estate is a great example of the power and elegance of this picture perfect vintage. This consumer friendly 100% Pinot Noir spent 1 year in French Oak. A dark ruby red hue with flavorful aromas of primarily red fruit like cherries with blueberries and vanilla. Creamy red fruit on the palate, including cherry pie, pomegranate, red plum, blueberry, cranberry, and nutmeg. Suave, smooth and food friendly. Pair with veal chops, grilled salmon, cornish game hens, chicken dishes and striped bass. Best enjoyed now through 2019.

Name: Chateauneuf-du-Pape Tradition
Tasting Notes: RP-The 2010 Chateauneuf du Pape Tradition exhibits a classic Provencal nose of roasted herbs, kirsch liqueur, lavender, forest floor and balsam wood. It is an impressively built, concentrated, deep ruby/purple-colored effort that should drink well for 10-15 years.

Winery: ST: Bright purple. Aromas and flavors of black raspberry and blueberry with spice and floral notes adding complexity. Juicy and focused, with very good finishing clarity and lingering floral and spicecake nuances. Tannins came up with aeration but weren't a match for this wine's energetic fruit.

Name: Simbolo Red (Douro)
Tasting Notes: The 2009 Simbolo is a blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca and Tinta Barroca, aged in a combination of French and American oak for 18 months. Easily the pick of the litter in the releases reviewed this issue, this is remarkably gracious and beautifully balanced. As it airs out, it shows some grip and intensity, always subtle and restrained, while remaining quite persistent.

Winery: WE: A blend of grapes from Poças’s two estates, here is a firmly structured, ageworthy wine. It has power, certainly, but that power is restrained by tannins, acidity and a firm, dry center. There is spice from the wood aging, along with a touch of pepper from alcohol. Approachable now, it could use a little time to settle down. Drink 2013-2021.

Name: Colheita Douro Red
Tasting Notes: Bottled in June 2009, nearly four years after harvest, this is a limited production wine. It has great structure, tannin and beautiful ripe fruits. With a perfumed black-currant character, it is ready to drink now, but its tannins suggest aging potential.
Notes: We had this with Joan and Donn as we planned our trip to Portugal. Wonderful, especially the finish.

Name: Cote de Nuit-Villages Clos de Magny
Tasting Notes: The outstanding 2010 vintage was a concentrated low yield vintage that will go down as one of the best in recent history. Winemaker Greg Patria has done a very nice job on this wine that has screaming good value. A dark red hue. Intense aromas of wild strawberries, black raspberries and dark plum. A full palate of primarily dark red fruit interwoven with blueberries including dark cherries, dark chocolate and licorice with dollops of red flowers, minerality and a spice box. Mouthwatering, and well structured, with nice complexity and good length.

Name: Valpolicella Ripasso
Tasting Notes: Richly aromatic, with overtones of grilled herb, pekoe tea leaf and smoke accenting the damson plum, red currant and licorice flavors. Light- to medium-bodied and firm in style, this will match well with food. Drink now through 2018. 3,000 cases made.

Winery: Wonderful black cherry flavors...medium-bodied, great with a light shrimp pasta.

Name: Azienda Agricola Monte Del Fra Di Bonomo Eligio Claudio E Marica S.s.
Costieres de Nimes JT
Tasting Notes: The 2011 Château de Nages Costières-de-Nîmes JT has an almost young Cornas-like profile! A blend of 95% Syrah and 5% Mourvedre that is fermented with

Winery: some whole cluster, it boasts knockout aromatics of violets, raspberry, bacon fat, and pepper, as well as a medium to full-bodied, rich, yet very fresh and focused palate. The stem inclusion really shows here and gives the wine additional complexity, as well as a grippy, structured feel in the mouth. This fantastic Costières-de-Nîmes should benefit from short-term cellaring, and drink well for a decade. (92-94 pts.)
Name: S.a.r.l. Michel Gassier
Mitsuko's Vineyard Pinot Noir
Tasting Notes: JN-Pretty aromas of red and dark red fruit, including dark cherries, plum, pomegranate and chocolate. Nice depth of complexity and layered with suave fruit and a pleasing mouth feel. A nice sip of dark cherries, blueberries, pomegranate, and black raspberries with red flowers with a touch of a cinnamon spice.

Name: La Crois du Coq Cotes du Rhone Villages
Tasting Notes: The 2011 Cotes du Rhone-Villages La Croix du Coq is 100% Grenache, from rocky, clay soils, that spent 10 months in tank prior to bottling. Deep, rich and layered, it offers a slightly reticent bouquet of black cherries and assorted dark fruits intermixed with notions of licorice, toasted spice, chocolate and chalky minerality. Slightly straightforward at present, it has solid mid-palate depth and should continue to improve with another year or so in bottle. It’s a rock-solid bottle of Grenache that over-delivers at the price. Drink 2014-2020.

Name: Meiomi Pinot Noir
Tasting Notes: Deep, rich garnet color. The wine opens up with aromas of ripe berries, fresh cranberry, candy apple and malted vanilla, some of which carries through to the palate. There’s a hint of Granny Smith apple on first sip that beautifully balances out the rich cream soda and cherry cola notes. It is an extremely layered wine, both in structure and flavor, with a slight earthiness and sweet oak on the finish. The wine almost contradicts itself, managing to display freshness and maturity all at the same time, which is achieved through careful blending.

Name: Clos Pegase Cabernet Sauvignon
Tasting Notes: Shows saturated ruby purple color. It has intense, complex dark fruit notes of ripe black cherry, blackberry coulis and plum framed by dark chocolate, graphite, violets and a touch of sweet incense smoke

Name: Rutherford-Napa Cabernet Sauvignon
Tasting Notes: JN: A very nice 100% Caberne. It spent over 18 months in French Oak, 80% of which is new. A deep red hue with purple highlights. Elegant and pleasing aromas of dark cherries, mocha, red currants, licorice and dark chocolate. The palate is lush and layered with dark cherry, plum, espresso, toasty vanilla oak, kirsch, and beef jerky, with touches of pepper and nutmeg spice. Enjoy Now through 2020. As this wine has just been bottled in the winter of 2014, it is my recommendation that ideally it receives some bottle age

Name: Old Vines Field Blend
Tasting Notes: Blend of zin, carignan, petite sirah, mourvedre and alicante bouschet. Great aromas of boysenberry, violets and dark plum. On the tongue, lots of black fruits and black cherry liquer.

Name: Enebral Tinta de Toro
Tasting Notes: "The 2009 Enebral spent nearly a year in new French oak before bottling without filtration. Aromas of toasty oak, mineral, spice box, licorice, and blackberry compose the bouquet of this round, supple, nicely proportioned wine."

Name: Chateauneuf-du-Pape Cuvee Anonyme La Reserve VII IX X
Tasting Notes: RP: a blend of the top barrels of the Cuvee Anonyme from 2007 (43%), 2009 (21%) and 2010 (36%), deep purple/black, hedonistic and decadent with massive amounts of black raspberry, raspberry, spice cake, licorice and crushed flowers on the nose. Full bodied and textured on the palate with wonderful freshness and purity. Should easily last for 15+ years -- Oct. 2010. Garrique?
Notes: First collector purchase from WineAccess. We'll see. By Xavier Vignon. Wine Access believes it could be upgraded to 100.

Name: Napa Valley Syrah
Tasting Notes: The 2009 Syrah has aromas of red and black raspberries, violets, and green peppercorn framed by notes of cedar and sandalwood. A plush mid-palate and satisfying texture finish with persistent fruit and minerality.

Name: Napa Valley Syrah
Tasting Notes: Because of our very special relationship with Clos Pegase winery, we are able to make a very unique and yet small lot available to our members at a fraction of the regular cost in this special and extraordinary opportunity. This includes one bottle each of their 2009 and 2010 Syrah, and 1 bottle each of their 2009 and 2010 Cab Franc. The Syrah typically costs $40 a bottle at the winery and the Cab Franc sells for $35 a bottle. The Syrah is from the Mitsuko’s vineyard in Carneros and less than 500 cases in each vintage is produced. The Cab Franc is from the Dunaweal vineyard in Calistoga and the Mitsuko’s Vineyard in Carneros. About 650 cases are produced in each vintage. Only a small fraction of these wines are still even available. The winery loves the marketing benefits of reaching our who’s who list of the top wine lovers in the country! The very nice 2010 vintage is just released, and the 09 is certainly a great vintage. What a unique opportunity for the ultimate varietal/vertical pairing of these two amazing wines from 2 great vintages! This is one of Jan’s Shrem’s boutique micro-bottlings that he made as a special treat for his Wine Club members. It is made from his top Estate single vineyards in Calistoga.”Clos Pegase” is clearly one of Napa’s most famed properties and is named for an enclosed vineyard and the winged horse of Greek mythology. The winery was founded in 1983 and the spectacular architecture commissioned by Michael Graves was completed in 1987. Given the price, and the delicious taste profile, this is certainly quite an offering that we are confident our members will love!

Name: Cotes du Rhone Rasteau
Tasting Notes: The more impressive is the 2011 Rasteau Vieilles Vignes. Comprised of 70% Grenache and 30% Syrah — aged all in concrete — that was harvested late in September, its inky purple color is followed by a dense, serious bouquet of black fruits, plum, new leather and graphite. This full-bodied, structured and fresh effort is one of the more serious Rasteaus in the vintage. Drink it over the coming 8-9 years. Drink 2014-2022.

Winery: 92+ points -- Robert Parker's The Wine Advocate (December 2013)

The brilliant 2011 Cotes du Rhone-Villages Rasteau Vieilles Vignes has an opaque purple color as well as notes of ink, graphite, chocolate fudge, blackberries and kirsch. It is full-bodied, dense and powerful on the palate. Drink it over the next decade.
91-93 points -- Robert Parker's The Wine Advocate (October 2012
